name: Good Genes All-In-One AHA Lactic Acid Treatment
about: What it is:An AHA serum with lactic acid that targets the look of pores, hyperpigmentation, and dark spots while clinically improving the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles..Skin Type:Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily.Skincare Concerns:Dark Spots, Fine Lines and Wrinkles, and Pores.Highlighted Ingredients:- Purified Lactic Acid: Hydrates and exfoliates the surface layers of skin, smoothing the look of texture, lines, and wrinkles while visibly clarifying blemishes..Ingredient Callouts:Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance. It is also vegan, gluten-free, cruelty-free, and comes in recyclable packaging..What Else You Need to Know:Formulated with hydrating purified-grade lactic acid, this formula exfoliates dull surface cells for younger-looking skin with visible clarity and radiance. It also contains licorice extract to brighten the appearance of dark spots and hyperpigmentation. Great for all skin types (from acne- and blemish-prone to dry and sensitive), this visibly age-diminishing solution keeps skin looking clear and glowing..Clinical Results:In a clinical test using profilometry analysis:
ingredients: -Purified Lactic Acid: Hydrates and exfoliates the surface layers of skin, smoothing the look of texture, lines, and wrinkles while visibly clarifying blemishes..-Licorice and Lemongrass: Visibly brighten dark spots and discoloration..-Prickly Pear Extract: Soothes the appearance of surface redness and sensitive skin...Botanical Blend [Aqua, Opuntia Tuna Fruit Extract, Cypripedium Pubescens Extract, Opuntia Vulgaris Leaf Extract, Agave Tequilana Leaf Extract, Arnica Montana Flower Extract, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Saccharomyces Cerevisiae (Yeast) Extract, Leuconostoc/Radish Root Ferment Filtrate], Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Squalane, Lactic Acid, PPG-12/SMDI Copolymer, Propanediol, Butylene Glycol, Stearic Acid, Dimethicone, Cetearyl Alcohol, Phenyl Trimethicone, Disiloxane, Ceteareth-20, Glyceryl Stearate, PEG-100 Stearate, Stearyl Glycyrrhetinate, Glycyrrhiza Glabra Root Extract, Cymbopogon Schoenanthus (Lemongrass) Oil, Potassium Hydroxide, Phenoxyethanol, Xanthan Gum, Caprylyl Glycol, Chlorphenesin, Sodium Phytate...The list of ingredients is subject to change. Please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Can be used in the morning or evening toward the beginning of your skincare routine. .-Apply one or two pumps to clean, dry skin and leave on.  ..For sensitive skin, try as a mask:.-Apply one to three pumps to clean, dry skin and leave on for 15 minutes..-Rinse well and pat dry...Sunday says:.-Try applying Good Genes All-In One Lactic Acid Treatment over an oil such as C.E.O. Glow Vitamin C + Turmeric Face Oil for double the visible brightening and rejuvenating power. Oily or combination skin may not even need to be moisturized.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Sunday Riley's Good Genes serum is a game-changer! Its delightful fragrance is a cherry on top, making skincare feel like a luxurious ritual. Unlike some products that trigger breakouts, this one is gentle yet effective, leaving my skin clear and radiant. I apply it three times a week before bed, and each morning I wake up to unbelievably soft and smooth skin. The transformative power of this serum is evident; it has not only softened my skin but also improved its texture remarkably. I second all the reviews saying that a little bit goes a long way! I've had my current full size for almost a year, which does make the price point more economical. I couldn't recommend it more for anyone seeking a skincare staple that delivers on its promises without irritation.

Iu2019ve religiously purchased these two products and also gifted them because they work so incredibly well. Unlike countless other products Iu2019ve purchased, these give me fresh, glowing, anti-aging results that more than justify the costs. I also find it impressive that a few pumps is more than plenty to treat my face, neck and decollete. Iu2019m doing my Sunday night Luna + GG mask as I write this review because I need to add more to my basket. I purchase once a year and use them every other night and GG most mornings to prep my face for makeupu2014thatu2019s how little I use to get awesome results!GG is so moisturizing I rarely wear moisturizer overtop except in dry winter months. This is the best and most gentle regular exfoliating treatment Iu2019ve ever triedu2014love it!

reviews.review_text: Sunday Riley Good Genes Serum has completely transformed my skincare routine, and I can't sing its praises enough!  First and foremost, the results are nothing short of remarkable. After just a few weeks of consistent use, my skin has become noticeably smoother, brighter, and more even-toned. Those pesky fine lines and dark spots have significantly faded, and my complexion has never looked better. This serum truly lives up to its promise of delivering good genes to your skin.  What sets this serum apart is its powerful yet gentle formula. It's loaded with potent ingredients like lactic acid, which exfoliates and renews the skin without causing irritation. I have sensitive skin, and I've experienced no redness or discomfort while using this product. It's a game-changer for anyone looking to achieve that coveted radiant glow.  The packaging is not only aesthetically pleasing but also practical. The pump dispenser ensures that I get the right amount of product every time without any waste.  I also appreciate that Sunday Riley is a cruelty-free brand, and this serum is free from harsh chemicals. It's a product I feel good about using on my skin.  While it's a bit on the pricier side, a little goes a long way, so the bottle lasts a while. Considering the incredible results, it's worth every penny.  In summary, Sunday Riley Good Genes Serum is a skincare superstar that delivers on its promises. If you're looking to invest in your skin's health and achieve a radiant complexion, look no further. This serum has become a holy grail product in my routine, and I can't recommend it enough!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: When it comes to Alpha Hydroxy Acids my skin prefers Lactic over Glycolic any day, as it's gentler, and this formula containing Lactic plus Licorice and a host of botanicals is good stuff! I try not to use anything containing AHA's during the daytime as I'm never convinced I've reapplied my SPF sufficiently to protect against the strong Florida sun. For that reason I use it on a night time only. The texture of Good Genes is light and would suit most skin types I'd imagine, other than possibly sensitive. Having an oilier skin type myself, I find I usually don't need to use a moisturizer once I've applied this as it hydrates sufficiently on its own. Results-wise: I found my skin tone generally brighter within a week of starting use and also it feels much smoother - definitely down to the Lactic Acid. It does contain silicones, however they are thankfully much further down the ingredients list then most silicone-containing products. I came across concerns in other reviews about the 'essential oils' in the formulation so I did a spot of detective work... of the 2 oils in here, Meadowfoam Seed Oil is a non-photo toxic carrier oil and Lemongrass oil is an essential oil, although not a photo toxic one either, and therefore no reason for concern. I have tried the 'Glycolic' version of 'Good Genes' too, which I purchased in the UK but found it to be too strong, the Lactic acid formulation we have here in the states suits me much better.   ~ My Sephora Top 7 must-have list ~  (My top 7 must-have beauty products of all time, focusing mainly on my purchases at Sephora)  1. reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This product was gifted by Sunday Riley.  I have normal/combo skin with some fine lines, dark spots and dullness. This treatment has worked so well for my skin! I was a bit nervous to try it because I wasn't sure if it would agree with my skin but now I wish I'd started using it sooner.  My big problem area in terms of signs of aging is the frown lines forming on the corners of my mouth and this has softened them in just two weeks.  I also have enlarged pores on my cheeks around my nose and those are getting better as well.  Overall I feel like my skin looks great and has improved clarity and texture.  For reference I use this every other night and use a generous amount and let it sink in before adding night cream on top.  That regimen seems to be working great for me!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: A little goes a long way. Usually a few overnight applications and my skin starts looking like glass skin. The only negative it has a very chemical floor cleaner like smell.

Absolutely adore this product. I have combo skin and my lower cheeks are prone to dryness while closer to my T zone.. a little oily. I find that when you have combo skin or dry patches, itu2019s SUPER important to know what your skin needs. I pump two pumps onto the back of my hand and mix a bit before I distribute it to my face. And I focus more on the dry patches before moving towards the middle of my face. After it dried I swipe my aquaphor stick on and BOOM Iu2019m soft Iu2019m dewy Iu2019m happy u2764ufe0f

It does have a bit of a scent to it but nothing off-putting. Definitely give this a try if youu2019re looking for clear skin that helps with fine lines. Gifted by Sunday Riley

reviews.review_title: Disappointed, not my unicorn, moving on.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have combo skin, oily in the T-zone and dry on my cheeks. I'm 41 and while I don't look it yet, I would like to keep it that way. I personally feel like I'm starting to look it faster and faster these days. I was looking for a product to help smooth fine lines and wrinkles, and of course slow the clock down as much as possible.   Due to the rave reviews I have read about Sunday Riley, especially the Luna, I was excited to try all of her products. Around Christmas I purchased 2 of the go to bed with me sets. I felt like this was a good cost effective measure to get a real test run on the whole system (cleanser, essence, A+, 5 star, Luna, Good Genes and Ice).   $200 later and a few months, I'm here to report that I'm not impressed. I'm not sure what the hype is about. I didn't see any improvement from the A+, 5 star, Luna, Ice, or Good Genes. Maybe it is just not right for my skin but I honestly think whether it was right for me or not, there should have been some effect or minor improvement. My only other complaint is about the Luna, it doesn't soak in, you go to bed slimy.   On the other hand, the two products I didn't expect to really care about but ended up really liking are the essence (Pink Drink) and the cleanser (Ceramic Slip). Still, I don't expect I will be purchasing them. It's a consideration in the future. Right now I'm over Sunday Riley and will continue my search for my skincare unicorn.
